definitions.definition: a small flat round piece of medicine that you swallow whole, without biting it

examples.text: Take three pills daily after meals.
**pill-popping** *(= the act of taking too many pills or using illegal drugs)*
The doctor prescribed her some pills to help her sleep.
I was on various pills for my heart condition.

definitions.definition: a pill that some women take to prevent them becoming pregnant

examples.text: Her doctor put her on the pill at 16.

definitions.definition: a fact or an event that is unpleasant and difficult to accept

examples.text: The election defeat was a bitter pill for the party to swallow.

definitions.definition: to do something that makes an unpleasant situation seem less unpleasant

wordOrigin: noun late Middle English: ultimately from Latin pilula ‘little ball’, diminutive of pila; compare with Middle Dutch, Middle Low German pille.
